snippet: Two studies in The Journal of the American Medical Association provide new clues, but many questions remain.
abstract: Two studies published in The Journal of the American Medical Association identify the most common causes of stillbirth, which occurs at a higher rate in the United States than in many other developed countries; studies find that known risk factors explain only a minority of stillbirth cases and conclude that more research is needed, particularly concerning disparities among races and ethnicities.
lead_paragraph: Two studies in The Journal of the American Medical Association provide new clues, but many questions remain.

headline.seo: Stillbirth Causes Are Tallied, but Risks Remain a Challenge
headline.main: New Clues Revealed in Studies of Stillbirth
headline.print_headline: New Clues Revealed In Studies Of Stillbirth

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
